turn.1: What was the 1995 Southern Conference Men's Basketball Tournament?
turn.2: 1995 Southern Conference Men's Basketball Tournament The 1995 Southern Conference Men's Basketball Tournament took place from March 2–5, 1995 at the Asheville Civic Center in Asheville, North Carolina.
turn.4: The Chattanooga Mocs, led by head coach Mack McCarthy, won their seventh Southern Conference title and received the automatic berth to the 1995 NCAA Tournament.
turn.5: What was the format of the tournament?
turn.6: This was the first year in which the conference utilized a division format, with five teams divided into two divisions, the "North" and "South".
turn.7: Which teams were invited to the tournament?
turn.8: All of the conference's ten members were eligible for the tournament.
turn.10: Teams were seeded based on conference winning percentage.
turn.11: What is a notable fact about the tournament?
turn.12: The tournament used a preset bracket consisting of four rounds, the first of which featured two games, with the winners moving on to the quarterfinal round.
